key_title: Key to the species of Maireana

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Chenopodiaceae

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Chenopodiaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Walsh, N.G. (1996). Chenopodiaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Fruiting perianth with 5 horizontal wings
Fruiting perianth with a single horizontal wing, sometimes the wing very narrow (or not developed in M. microphylla), sometimes accessory wings present above and/or below horizontal wing
Fruiting perianth with erect, club-shaped processes arising vertically from summit
Wings of fruiting perianth lacking erect processes
Wings very narrow, margins thickened or narrowly incurved; fruiting perianth 5 mm wide or less; prostrate or decumbent herb
Wings obovate to fan-shaped (or lacking); fruiting perianth 6 mm wide or more (except sometimes in M. microphylla when wings do not develop) more or less erect herbs or shrubs
Wings of fruiting perianth pubescent with curled hairs
Wings of fruiting perianth glabrous
Two of the five wings smaller and suberect; leaves often opposite; plants usually dioecious
Wings equal and horizontal; leaves alternate; flowers bisexual
Wings free to base; leaves glabrous, distinctly tapered toward base; perianth lobes developing spongy dorsal humps in fruit
Wings fused for more than half their length; leaves often hairy, not tapered at base
Fruiting perianth more than 5 mm diam., usually distinctly winged, the tube usually tapered above and/or below the wing
Fruiting perianth less than 5 mm diam., pentagonal, truncate, very narrowly winged near base, usually immersed in hairs; prostrate to decumbent herb with woody base; branches woolly
Fruiting perianth with erect, club-shaped processes arising vertically from summit
Wings of fruiting perianth lacking erect processes from summit, but sometimes vertically winged along tube
Tube of fruiting perianth with 3–5 vertical wings
Tube of fruiting perianth without vertical wings
Plant glabrous except for tufts of hairs in leaf axils
Plant hairy on branches, with hairs not confined to leaf axils
Vertical wings attached along length of tube and united at apex with horizontal wing; summit of fruiting perianth flat or slightly convex
Vertical wings often present only towards base of tube; summit of fruiting perianth conspicuously convex due to enlarged and arched perianth lobes
Wing of fruit pubescent above
Wing of fruit glabrous (but perianth lobes sometimes pubescent)
Perianth tube with a hard, rounded base; leaves elliptic to narrowly obovate; plant prostrate or decumbent
Perianth tube thin-walled, the base expanded into a hollow stipe; leaves semi-terete; plant erect or ascending
Fruiting perianth above wing prominently raised with enlarged perianth lobes; divaricately branched shrub of far north-west
Fruiting perianth flat, concave or slightly convex above wing
Tube of fruiting perianth expanded into a hollow, spongy base; perennial herb
Tube of fruiting perianth not or hardly expanded at base
Wing of fruiting perianth entire, mostly 15–20 mm diam.; tube turbinate
Wing of fruiting perianth with radial slit
Tube of fruiting perianth thick-walled; wing 14–20 mm diam.
Tube of fruiting perianth thin-walled; wing less than 14 mm diam.
Tube of fruiting perianth pubescent; leaves obovoid or clavate, appearing bluish or silvery from a close indumentum
Tube of fruiting perianth glabrous; other features not as above
Fruiting perianth open at summit and exposing the utricle
Fruiting perianth closed at summit
Shrubs stiffly divaricately branched, older branches leafless, often spinescent
Shrubs not stiffly branched, remaining leafy, never spinescent
Flowers scattered or in loose spikes; spines stout; fruiting perianth 8–10 mm diam.
Flowers in dense leafy spikes; spines (if present) slender and weak; fruiting perianth to 7 mm diam., but wing usually not developed and then fruit c. 1.5–3 mm diam.
Branchlets glabrous except for small tufts of hair in leaf axils
Branchlets sparsely to densely covered with cottony hairs
Wing of fruiting perianth 6–10 mm diam., flat or weakly undulate
Wing of fruiting perianth 11–16 mm diam., often (strongly) undulate
Leaves and stems weakly pubescent; flowers in dense leafy spikes; divaricately branched shrub; wing of fruiting perianth often not developed
Leaves and stems white-woolly; flowers scattered; branches not divaricate; wing of fruiting perianth usually developed
Summit of fruiting perianth glabrous or glabrescent; wings lacking prominent dark radiating nerves
Summit of fruiting perianth pubescent; wings with obvious dark, radiating nerves
Fruiting perianth with distinctly raised pentagonal ridge
Fruiting perianth with 5 radial ridges, each extending to a corner of the fruit
